data.title: Holzemer v. Tharp, et al
authors: US District Court for the Northern District of Ohio
data.meta_description: Labor: Family and Medical Leave Act case filed on October 2, 2018  in the Ohio Northern District Court
data.text: November 19, 2018 Filing 8 Entry of Appearance of attorney John Borell and Elaine Szuch and Motion for extension of time until January 2, 2019 to answer Plaintiff's Complaint filed by Lucas County Sheriff's Office, John Tharp. (Szuch, Elaine) Modified text on 11/28/2018 (D,TM). November 7, 2018 Filing 7 Waiver of Service Returned Executed by Dana Holzemer. Lucas County Sheriff's Office waiver sent on 10/4/2018, answer due 12/3/2018 filed on behalf of Dana Holzemer (Landry, Francis) November 7, 2018 Filing 6 Waiver of Service Returned Executed by Dana Holzemer. John Tharp waiver sent on 10/4/2018, answer due 12/3/2018 filed on behalf of Dana Holzemer (Landry, Francis) October 4, 2018 Filing 5 Notice of a Lawsuit and Request to Waive Service of a Summons (directed to Defendant Lucas County Sheriff) filed by Dana Holzemer. (Landry, Francis) October 4, 2018 Filing 4 Notice of a Lawsuit and Request to Waive Service of a Summons (Directed to Defendant John Tharp, Lucas County Sheriff) filed by Dana Holzemer. (Landry, Francis) October 3, 2018 Filing 3 Magistrate Consent Form issued. Summons were not provided and were not issued. (M,L) October 3, 2018 Filing 2 Supplement to Complaint, - Civil Cover Sheet, filed by Dana Holzemer. Related document(s) #1 . (Landry, Francis) October 3, 2018 Notice re Prompt Service. Counsel for Plaintiff is responsible for promptly serving the Complaint on Defendant(s) upon receiving the issued summons from the Clerk and, after service has been perfected, electronically filing a Return of Service or an executed Waiver of Service for each Defendant.Service is to be accomplished pursuant to Fed. R. Civ. P. 4, which includes provisions for personal service and waiver of service, and Local Rule 4.2. If you wish the Clerk to serve the Complaint on Defendant(s) (a seldom used alternative because it does not save time or money), you must provide the Clerk's office with copies of the Complaint along with other necessary documents, in the manner set forth in Local Rule 4.2(a). (M,L) October 3, 2018 Judge James G. Carr assigned to case. (M,L) October 3, 2018 Random Assignment of Magistrate Judge pursuant to Local Rule 3.1. In the event of a referral, case will be assigned to Magistrate Judge James R. Knepp, II. (M,L)
